C.Data Backup -
A data management strategy is essential to ensure that data is stored, accessed, and protected effectively. While naming conventions and color coding can help organize data, data backup is a critical component because it ensures that data is recoverable in case of accidental deletion, hardware failure, or other data loss scenarios.

Backup strategies typically involve regular, automated backups and secure storage of backup data, either on-site, off-site, or in the cloud.

A. Naming Convention

Naming conventions are crucial in a data management strategy as they provide a consistent and organized way to identify and categorize data. This helps in ensuring data is easily accessible, understandable, and maintainable across the organization.
